definition: A style or manner of doing something, often referring to a distinctive way of behaving, speaking, or carrying oneself. It is commonly used to describe someone's characteristic behavior or a particular way of expressing oneself.

examples.german: Er hat eine seltsame Manier, immer mit den Fingern zu schnippen.
examples.english: He has a strange manner of always snapping his fingers.

examples.german: Sie spricht mit einer gewissen Manier, die mich fasziniert.
examples.english: She speaks with a certain manner that fascinates me.

examples.german: Seine Manier zu lachen ist sehr ansteckend.
examples.english: His manner of laughing is very contagious.

examples.german: Die Manier, wie er sich kleidet, ist immer sehr elegant.
examples.english: The manner in which he dresses is always very elegant.

examples.german: Sie hat eine Manier, immer alles perfekt zu organisieren.
examples.english: She has a manner of always organizing everything perfectly.
